website_summaries.verdict: A multi-purpose heads-up display that can produce numerous types of vehicle data. However, if you want a model that can project readings to your windshield, consider other options on our list.
pros: Provides multiple functions, as it can also be used as a diagnostic tool
Has a HD LCD screen that is vivid and easy to read
Capable of displaying almost any vehicle data, including speed in miles per hour or kilometers per hour, vehicle stats, RPMs, temperature
Will turn on and off with the start or stop of your car
cons: Can be confusing to set up
Occasionally freezes, requiring it to be turned on and off to reset
Doesn't project readings onto the windshield, which can be distracting

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit!
customer_reviews.text: This item works pretty good....MPH seems to be pretty accurate in my 2012 Infiniti QX56, so I'm assuming it will work the same in all Nissan Infiniti vehicles. I didn't play with any of the adjustments yet...Just switched to MPH. Unit turns on with car and turns off with car. Toggle switch in back seems a bit weak...hopefully it will last. Pretty nice for the money. I would recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: WoodzyVision

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Connect
customer_reviews.text: This device did not work and it was not new. It looks like I received someone else's return. The sticker under my hood says that my vehicle is obd2 compatible. When I plugged in the device, it just said "connecting" and then the device would turn off. Either I received a lemon or this device can not support J1850 Protocol, which is found in many domestic vehicles. Having a obd2 interface in your vehicle does not mean that this device will work. There is more to it than that and it should have been explained better in the description. There also should be better instructions on how to remove the pins.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: but liked it so much I put it in my work ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my personal vehicle, but liked it so much I put it in my work truck. Easy set up, and nice to have the quick view of the OBD II readings at the touch of a button. Easy to see in the bright south Texas sun, too. Will buy another one to put back in my personal truck as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I connected the speedometer to my OBD 2 and it started smoking! If I connected it then went back in the house my car would be on fire. It must’ve been something with the wiring so please be careful and do not leave it unattended. if the wire get extremely hot, take it out and throw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in MazdaSpeed3 2012
customer_reviews.text: Works great in MazdaSpeed3 2012. Light adjusts for night time, data streaming function is great and screen is a nice size for showing info and not being too big. I highly recommend. I used to have the 5" version you see all over amazon that uses the window reflection sticker, this is much better for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Ford Expedition ODB2 j1850 does not work
customer_reviews.text: Ford Expedition ODB2 j1850 does not work. Stuck at trying to connect screen. Occasionally will bring up speed interface screen but stays on 0 mph. Was able to get into set up mode once but not again. So either a defective unit or just not compatible. Instructions are ridiculous and lacking. If plug and play does not work for you pack it up and return.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works great on my 2009 Sable. The speedometer is very hard to read being silver on black and small. But, I love the car except for this problem and this unit corrects this problem for me. I've tried units that reflect on the windshield and this works much better than those did. I wish that I had found this unit years ago.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Never got it to turn on past opening message.  Unable to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't ever turn on. When plugged into port the screen shows message: "OBD SMART METER" "connecting...." doesn't matter if car is powered on or not. Fine print manual very hard to read. Setup steps incomplete. Found decent install video online. There is some incomplete information about OBD pins and which ones to pull.
customer_reviews.author: capndino

customer_reviews.title: After a year of use still love it
customer_reviews.text: Great for codes. Sometimes it only gives you the number but all you have to do is Google the number and it comes right up. I got it because my dash lights dont work so I didn't know how fast I was going at night. I've been using for over a year now. 0 complaints. Plan on getting more for my other cars.
customer_reviews.author: Slurmz

customer_reviews.title: If you have ever had a speeding ticket you need this unit!
customer_reviews.text: Where I live the police are under a tight quota system, knowing your exact speed is vital. This product is excellent I used to use my garmin for a quick glance at my speed I switched to my phone for traffic updates and it does not provide the vital speed information. This product helps me easily stay ahead of those money hungry cretins.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Banks

customer_reviews.title: Good little add on.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to give me a little more info regarding temp-voltage - etc.. Plugged it in and its been doing its thing for about a year without a single issue - would recommend..
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Can’t recommend, but I might have a faulty one.
customer_reviews.text: About once a month my battery would be dead. I couldn’t figure out what was happening until I realized it started once I had installed this device. Once I unplugged it the issue went away. I’m not sure what the problem is, so it’s hard to recommend this product. Other than that I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: cjlizzard

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit..I got more than I expected out of this thing..it also reads and clear codes..great display..tons of settings ..definitely 5 star for the price..fast shipping..just check to make sure it's compatible with your vehicle..mines a crown vic..100% would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Christopher pipes

customer_reviews.title: Replacement works well
customer_reviews.text: The first Leaningtech P10, worked,then stopped working. I think there was a problem with a loose connection. The replacement seems to be working fine. I am using it as a digital readout for the speedometer.
customer_reviews.author: kathypro

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time Delayed the speed reading which can cause more trouble than you’d expect. Actually, it’s dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Nice HUD!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Better than the units that have to have the reflection screen on the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Is pretty accurate with my car
customer_reviews.text: Is pretty accurate with my car, only sometimes it freezes while driving and I'll have to turn it off and then on again.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Hyundai install is super easy and all the readings work well
customer_reviews.text: 2013 Hyundai install is super easy and all the readings work well. The only issue is the ability to brighten the display and lower the brightness at night, doesn't do anything. It's set at one level and does not change. Otherwise it's awesome for the price....
customer_reviews.author: Jack R

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Like the product just right. Plugs right in the odb2 .
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Johnson

customer_reviews.title: like how small it is easy to read sometimes it ...
customer_reviews.text: like how small it is easy to read sometimes it freezes. unplug from obd port and plug back in starts it again.
customer_reviews.author: terry garrison
